name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $identifier
desc: Returns: Unique identifier for this copy of the Consent Statement.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Unique identifier for this copy of the Consent Statement.

name: $status
desc: Returns: Indicates the current state of this consent.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Indicates the current state of this consent.

name: $category
desc: Returns: A classification of the type of consents found in the statement. This element supports indexing and retrieval of consent statements.

name: $addcategory
desc: A classification of the type of consents found in the statement. This element supports indexing and retrieval of consent statements.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A classification of the type of consents found in the statement. This element supports indexing and retrieval of consent statements.

name: $patient
desc: Returns: The patient/healthcare consumer to whom this consent applies.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The patient/healthcare consumer to whom this consent applies.

name: $period
desc: Returns: Relevant time or time-period when this Consent is applicable.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Relevant time or time-period when this Consent is applicable.

name: $dateTime
desc: Returns: When this  Consent was issued / created / indexed.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: When this  Consent was issued / created / indexed.

name: $consentingParty
desc: Returns: Either the Grantor, which is the entity responsible for granting the rights listed in a Consent Directive or the Grantee, which is the entity responsible for complying with the Consent Directive, including any obligations or limitations on authorizations and enforcement of prohibitions.

name: $addconsentingParty
desc: Either the Grantor, which is the entity responsible for granting the rights listed in a Consent Directive or the Grantee, which is the entity responsible for complying with the Consent Directive, including any obligations or limitations on authorizations and enforcement of prohibitions.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Either the Grantor, which is the entity responsible for granting the rights listed in a Consent Directive or the Grantee, which is the entity responsible for complying with the Consent Directive, including any obligations or limitations on authorizations

name: $actor
desc: Returns: Who or what is controlled by this consent. Use group to identify a set of actors by some property they share (e.g. 'admitting officers').

name: $addactor
desc: Who or what is controlled by this consent. Use group to identify a set of actors by some property they share (e.g. 'admitting officers').

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Who or what is controlled by this consent. Use group to identify a set of actors by some property they share (e.g. 'admitting officers').

name: $action
desc: Returns: Actions controlled by this consent.

name: $addaction
desc: Actions controlled by this consent.

name: $organization
desc: Returns: The organization that manages the consent, and the framework within which it is executed.

name: $addorganization
desc: The organization that manages the consent, and the framework within which it is executed.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The organization that manages the consent, and the framework within which it is executed.

name: $policy
desc: Returns: The references to the policies that are included in this consent scope. Policies may be organizational, but are often defined jurisdictionally, or in law.

name: $addpolicy
desc: The references to the policies that are included in this consent scope. Policies may be organizational, but are often defined jurisdictionally, or in law.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The references to the policies that are included in this consent scope. Policies may be organizational, but are often defined jurisdictionally, or in law.

name: $policyRule
desc: Returns: A referece to the specific computable policy.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A referece to the specific computable policy.

name: $securityLabel
desc: Returns: A set of security labels that define which resources are controlled by this consent. If more than one label is specified, all resources must have all the specified labels.

name: $addsecurityLabel
desc: A set of security labels that define which resources are controlled by this consent. If more than one label is specified, all resources must have all the specified labels.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A set of security labels that define which resources are controlled by this consent. If more than one label is specified, all resources must have all the specified labels.

name: $purpose
desc: Returns: The context of the activities a user is taking - why the user is accessing the data - that are controlled by this consent.

name: $addpurpose
desc: The context of the activities a user is taking - why the user is accessing the data - that are controlled by this consent.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The context of the activities a user is taking - why the user is accessing the data - that are controlled by this consent.

name: $dataPeriod
desc: Returns: Clinical or Operational Relevant period of time that bounds the data controlled by this consent.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Clinical or Operational Relevant period of time that bounds the data controlled by this consent.

name: $data
desc: Returns: The resources controlled by this consent, if specific resources are referenced.

name: $adddata
desc: The resources controlled by this consent, if specific resources are referenced.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The resources controlled by this consent, if specific resources are referenced.

name: $except
desc: Returns: An exception to the base policy of this consent. An exception can be an addition or removal of access permissions.

name: $addexcept
desc: An exception to the base policy of this consent. An exception can be an addition or removal of access permissions.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: An exception to the base policy of this consent. An exception can be an addition or removal of access permissions.
